skill.name: clojure-review
skill.description: Review Clojure and ClojureScript code changes for compliance with Metabase coding standards, style violations, and code quality issues. Use when reviewing pull requests or diffs containing Clojure/ClojureScript code.
skill.summary: Review Clojure and ClojureScript code changes for compliance with Metabase coding standards, style v...
skill.author: unknown

security_audit.summary: No data theft, exfiltration, or malicious execution patterns found. The skill provides review guidance only and does not define tools or runtime actions.

content.user_title: Review Clojure diffs for Metabase standards
content.value_statement: Clojure reviews can miss style and quality issues. This skill applies Metabase conventions and flags violations consistently.
actual_capabilities: Check Clojure and ClojureScript diffs against Metabase style rules
Flag naming issues such as non-kebab case or missing bang for side effects
Identify missing docstrings for public vars
Highlight module, API, and REST conventions that are violated
Point out test organization and naming issues
limitations: Does not run linters or execute code
Does not verify behavior or runtime correctness
Only covers rules described in the skill text

use_cases.title: PR style review
use_cases.description: Review a Clojure PR for Metabase style violations before requesting feedback.

use_cases.title: Consistency checks
use_cases.description: Ensure team contributions follow shared naming and documentation standards.

use_cases.title: API guideline audit
use_cases.description: Scan API changes for route, schema, and parameter conventions.

prompt_templates.title: Basic PR check
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this Clojure diff for Metabase style violations only. List each issue and the rule it breaks.

prompt_templates.title: Docstring audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Check the diff for missing or weak docstrings on public vars in src. Report only docstring issues.

prompt_templates.title: API conventions
prompt_templates.prompt: Review API changes for route naming, parameter casing, and schema requirements. Report violations only.

prompt_templates.title: Full standards scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Scan this Clojure and ClojureScript diff against the Metabase style guide. Report all violations with brief fixes.

output_examples.input: Review this diff for Metabase Clojure style violations.
output: Public var foo lacks a docstring describing purpose and inputs
Side-effect function save-user is missing the ! suffix
Query parameter user_id should use kebab-case user-id

best_practices: Provide focused diffs with Clojure or ClojureScript code only
Ask for specific rule areas when you want a narrower review
Use the output to guide fixes, then re-run the review
anti_patterns: Using it to validate runtime behavior or performance
Asking for praise or approval comments
Ignoring documented rules in favor of personal style

faq.question: Is it compatible with ClojureScript?
faq.answer: Yes. It reviews both Clojure and ClojureScript code changes.

faq.question: What are the limits of the review?
faq.answer: It only checks rules described in the skill and does not run tests or linters.

faq.question: Can I integrate it into my PR workflow?
faq.answer: Yes. Use it as a checklist step when reviewing diffs.

faq.question: Does it access my files or secrets?
faq.answer: No. The skill text defines guidance only and has no data access.

faq.question: What if the results seem incomplete?
faq.answer: Provide more diff context or ask for a focused rule area.

faq.question: How is it different from generic review tools?
faq.answer: It enforces Metabase-specific conventions and examples.
